title: Inside the shift at Disrupt: Building community and scaling in the AI era
content: Nirav Tolia (Nextdoor), Jane Alexander (CapitalG), and Vanessa Larco (Premise, NEA) join TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 (October 27â€“29, SF) to share strategies for building resilient companies and scaling in the AI era.
author: TechCrunch Events
summary:
Key Takeaway: Leading experts discuss how AI is transforming the way late-stage startups approach go-to-market strategies, requiring them to adapt or risk being left behind.

Why It Matters: As AI becomes increasingly integrated into business operations, companies must rethink their growth models to stay competitive. Insights from industry veterans can help startups navigate this shift effectively.

Brief Context: At TechCrunch Disrupt 2025, a panel of seasoned entrepreneurs and investors will share their strategies for building resilient, scalable businesses in the AI-driven landscape. The discussion aims to provide practical guidance for startups seeking to thrive in the evolving tech ecosystem.

faq.question: How can companies build resilient communities in the AI era?
faq.answer: nswer: According to the article, Nirav Tolia of Nextdoor will share strategies for building resilient companies and scaling in the AI era at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025. This suggests that building strong, engaged communities will be key for companies looking to thrive in the AI-driven future.

faq.answer: nswer: The article mentions that Jane Alexander of CapitalG and Vanessa Larco of Premise and NEA will also speak at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 about scaling companies in the AI era.
